alert.note: Alert for Clark; Kiowa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kiowa, northwestern Comanche and northeastern Clark Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 643 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clark State Lake, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Kiowa, northwestern Comanche and northeastern Clark Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
